definitions.definition: The conclusive victory in a game of chess that occurs when an opponent's king is threatened with unavoidable capture.
(by extension) Any losing situation with no escape; utter defeat.
To put the king of an opponent into checkmate.
definitions.example: That jerk checkmated me in four moves!

definitions.definition: (by extension) To place in a losing situation that has no escape.
A fellow, comrade, colleague, partner or someone with whom something is shared, e.g. shipmate, classmate.
(especially of a non-human animal) A breeding partner.
A friend, usually of the same sex.
Friendly term of address to a stranger, usually male, of similar age
definitions.example: Excuse me, mate, have you got the time?

definitions.definition: In naval ranks, a non-commissioned officer or his subordinate (e.g. Boatswain's Mate, Gunner's Mate, Sailmaker's Mate, etc).
A ship's officer, subordinate to the master on a commercial ship.
A first mate.
A technical assistant in certain trades (e.g. gasfitter's mate, plumber's mate); sometimes an apprentice.
The other member of a matched pair of objects.
definitions.example: I found one of the socks I wanted to wear, but I couldn't find its mate.

definitions.definition: A suitable companion; a match; an equal.
To match, fit together without space between.
definitions.example: The pieces of the puzzle mate perfectly.

definitions.definition: To copulate.
To pair in order to raise offspring
To arrange in matched pairs.
To introduce (animals) together for the purpose of breeding.
(of an animal) To copulate with.
To marry; to match (a person).
To match oneself against; to oppose as equal; to compete with.
To fit (objects) together without space between.
To move (a space shuttle orbiter) onto the back of an aircraft that can carry it.
To confuse; to confound.
The abovementioned plant; the leaves and shoots used for the tea
Friendly; having a friendship (with).
definitions.example: He is mates with my brother.

definitions.definition: An evergreen tree, Ilex paraquariensis, native to South America, cultivated for its leaves.
A beverage, resembling tea, made from the dried leaves of this plant.
A cup of this drink.
